quizzes.title: History Quiz: Team and Cricket
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, officials, abbreviation. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: How many balls make up an over in a cricket match?
What does the abbreviation L.B.W stand for in cricket?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Leg Before Wicket

questions.question: What is the name of the bi-annual Cricket Series played between England and Australia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Ashes

questions.question: Which Brazilian team made a 10-year agreement in 2004 with the international fund of investors Media Sports Investment (MSI)?
Which team won the Brazilian Championship in 1978, beating Sao Paulo?
What is the maximum length of a modern day cricket test match?
In 2002, the team of Brazil became a FIFA World Cup winner beating the team of which country?
How many runs does a cricket batsman score by clearing the boundary of the playing field in a single hit?
How many wickets must fall (barring retirement or injury) for a cricket team to be all out?
Which team had Manuel Francisco dos Santos, the legendary Garrincha, playing for them for 45 minutes in a game against the Fluminense/RJ in the 1960s.
What is the length of a cricket pitch?
Which Brazilian team signed a contract with soccer legend Edson Arantes do Nascimento, Pelé, when he was just 15 years old?
Which team of Brazil won the first Club World Championship organized by FIFA?
What slang term is applied to a batsmans score of 0 in cricket?
What word refers to the match officials in a cricket match?

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Player and Goals
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, szabados, phillies. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Where was the first organized soccer team formed?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sheffield, England

questions.question: When was the Federation Internationale de Football Association formed?
Who was  he first man to win the tennis Grand Slam?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Don Budge

questions.question: Which Phillies player led the team in stolen bases in 1980?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lonnie Smith

questions.question: The first National Hockey League team in the USA was from this city.
Miklos Szabados, Cai Zhenhua, and Michael Maze are prominent players in this sport.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Table tennis

questions.question: Who was the first player to score over 1000 goals in soccer?
This player is considered one of the greatest Philadelphia Phillies players of all time. He played third base for the world champion Phillies in 1980.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mike Schmidt

questions.question: Which pitcher had the most  victories with the 1980 Philadelphia Phillies?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Steve Lefty Carlton

questions.question: In 1979, she became the first person to swim from the Bahamas to Florida.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Diane Nyad

questions.question: In which of these Brazilian championships soccer legend Pelé never played in a team which finished first?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Campeonato Brasileiro

questions.question: This player scored six goals at the 1997 match between Vasco/RJ and Uniao Joao de Araras, thus breaking the record for the most goals in a single game in the Brazilian Championship.
Who was the manager of the 1980 Philadelphia Phillies?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dallas Green

questions.question: In the 2004 Brazilian championship season, this player broke the record for most goals in a single season.

This Brazilian football player is one of the most famous Vasco da Gama players and one of the best goal scorers in the history of Brazilian football, with a total of 744 goals in his professional career.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roberto Dinamite

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Players and Following
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, college, smith. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Find the incorrect statement about Tiger Woods.

options.text: He won four straight US Amateur titles.
He has two half-brothers and one half-sister.
He was the first 15 year-old to win the US Junior Amateur Championship.
He was the youngest golfer to win all four majors in one year.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He won four straight US Amateur titles.

questions.question: In the 1960s the Brunswick Sporting Goods Company made a Snurfer, water ski with a rope in the front. This toy led to the development of which of the following?
Fred Gehrke was a running back for the then Los Angeles Rams. Which of the following did he do in 1948?

options.text: Scored a touchdown running, receiving and throwing.
Played all eleven positions in one game

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Painted horns on his helmet

questions.question: What team won the first college bowl game?
In 1963 a sports contest was held in Hermosa, California. Why was it significant?

options.text: It was the first baseball game between the Peoples Republic of China and the USA.
It was the last time Miami of Ohio played Miami of Florida on TV.
It was the first time the NFL played the AFL on television.
It was the first skateboarding championship.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It was the first skateboarding championship.

questions.question: This sport, which evolved from the medieval sports of  caid and cnapean, is played with either 13 or 15 players. (There are two modern variants.)
In 1886, Ab Smith added this term to sports vocabulary.
In 1963 the National Football League suspended these two players for gambling.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paul Hornung and Alex Karras

questions.question: In what state was the first American golf course opened?
In 1874 Major Clopton Wingfield revolutionized this sport.
This former NFL player is given credit for the first spike in the NFL.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Homer Jones

questions.question: Who was the first NHL player to score 50 goals in a season?
Name the first golfer to earn more than $100,000 in one year.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Arnold Palmer

questions.question: Patty Berg was quite a fine golfer. She won the first US Womans Open in 1946. What significant accomplishment did she make in 1959?

options.text: She wore a very revealing outfit.
She won the event and the tennis Grand Slam.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: She scored a hole-in-one.

questions.question: Who was the first NHL player to score 100 points in a season?

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Kung and Arts
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, yankees, world. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This teenager was the Mets starting shortstop in 1983.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jose Oquendo

questions.question: I was the third baseman for the Yankees when Dave Righetti threw his no hitter in 1983. Who am I?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bert Campaneris

questions.question: What pitcher pitched a no hitter on July 4th 1983?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dave Righetti

questions.question: What team won the World Series in 1980?
This player collected his 3000th hit in 1985. Who was this California Angels player ?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rod Carew

questions.question: What two teams played in the 1989 World Series?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: As vs. Giants

questions.question: What does the term Kung Fu refer to, apart from Chinese martial arts?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Individual accomplishment or skill

questions.question: What is the meaning of the concept of Chi, that plays a crucial role in the basic training of a student in Kung Fu?
In Chinese martial arts, the series of movements that are combined so they can be practiced as one set of movements are grouped in how many general types?
Although Kung Fu is often used in English as a collective term for Chinese martial arts, what is the more precise term for them?
Who was the last shortstop to start for the Baltimore Orioles before Cal Ripken stepped in and played 2,632 consecutive games?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Floyd Rayford

questions.question: Who was the manager of the 1986 New York Mets?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Davey Johnson

questions.question: Who won the 1984 World Series MVP award ?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alan Trammell

questions.question: What style of Kung Fu is not a Southern one?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eagle Claw

questions.question: Who is believed to have introduced martial arts in China?

options.text: The First Emperor Qin Shi Huangdi

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Yellow Emperor

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Kart and Karts
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, actor, tri-state. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of the following refers to the mechanics that work on the go kart?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pit Crew

questions.question: Karts can be driven on asphalt and dirt.
What Chinese literary genre is based on Chinese martial arts?
On what part of a kart  can you place a shield to improve aerodynamics?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: steering column

questions.question: Is it true that a normal kart race has three stages - tuning, driving and race?
Mark Messier holds the record for most played games in an NHL career.
What is the name of the main character in the American series Kung Fu (1972-1975)?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kwai Chang Caine

questions.question: What does WKA stand for?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: World Karting Association

questions.question: In a state or tri-state karting race all helmets must be Snell M2000 approved.
What Southern martial art did the Chinese American martial artist and actor Bruce Lee practise?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wing Chun

questions.question: Is it true that while racing a go kart, you should wear a hat, shorts and a T-shirt?
In the 1975-76 season, Darryl Sittler set the NHL record for most points scored in one game when he recorded this many points against the Boston Bruins.
What is a dao?
A go kart will go faster but handle worse, if you do which of the following?

options.text: Go down on the air pressure in the tires
Go up on the air pressure in the tires
Cut a whole in the front of the go kart

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Go up on the air pressure in the tires

questions.question: Go karts have two wheels.

quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, rookie, summer. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The United States

Wayne Gretzky played 21 seasons as a professional in the NHL.
